oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Consolidated abstract of provisions sold to officers

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- Army -- Subsistence Dept.; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Food supply; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page handwritten consolidated abstract of provisions form submitted by Lieutenant William Alonzo Wainwright, Regimental Quartermaster and Assistant Commissary of the 75th Indiana Infantry, reflecting subsistence stores sold to officers in the field for the month of January 1863. Indicated are articles, quantity sold, and amount charged.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Subsistence Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: U.S. Army regulations provided that officers might draw subsistence stores by paying in cash and would receive them at contract or cost prices, without including the cost of transportation. The senior lieutenant present (here William Alonzo Wainwright) was entitled to the appointment of Assistant Commissary of Subsistence for the regiment. Wainwright functioned as both Assistant Commissary and Assistant Quartermaster of the 75th Indiana Infantry.
